meanings.definition: A wedge or block placed against a wheel or rounded object to prevent it from moving.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic used a chock to stop the car from rolling down the hill.
meanings.sent2: Make sure to always use a chock when working on a vehicle to keep it in place.
meanings.sent3: The chock sat snugly under the wheel, like a little guardian holding it still.
meanings.sent4: The chock was a steadfast protector, keeping the tire from any unwanted adventures.
meanings.sent5: With a chock in place, the wheel was as secure as a fortress gate.

meanings.definition: To block or secure with a chock.
meanings.sent1: Please chock the boat before we set sail to keep it steady in the water.
meanings.sent2: I always chock the wheels of my trailer to prevent any accidental movement.
meanings.sent3: He decided to chock the door closed with a chair, much to his friends' amusement.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to succeed was like a chock, holding her ambitions firmly in place.
meanings.sent5: The idea of failure was enough to chock his progress, but he pushed forward nonetheless.

meanings.sent1: The theater was chock full of excited moviegoers on opening night.
meanings.sent2: The suitcase was chock with all the souvenirs she had collected on her trip.
meanings.sent3: The chock room made it impossible to find a seat, much to the guests' surprise.
meanings.sent4: Her heart felt chock with happiness as she celebrated her birthday with loved ones.
meanings.sent5: The market was chock with fresh fruits and vegetables, a colorful sight for all.
